subject: Re: linux connection dying?
body:
I've had a similar problem with eth 0 saying link up then a few minutes later, 
eth 0 link down and eth 0 link up.  Is this was what the origonal poster is 
describing?  Is this an indication that my network card has died? Is the a 
setting which could be causing this.  I'm running debian sarge on that system 
with updates as of last August.

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Hart Larry" 
To: 
Sent: Thursday, May 03, 2007 3:16 PM
Subject: Re: linux connection dying?


> Well, I had a similar problem where especially if I were running file sharing
> programs, my connection would drop, I had to power-cycle the modem.  What we
> found was a setting in the high-speed modem where keep alive was set to 10
> minutes, so we changed it to 999, now I have no issues like this--and I've run
> mutella-and-17 bittorrent sessions along with an ssh.
